brahmpuri-rafting.name: Brahmpuri Club Rafting
brahmpuri-rafting.tagline: The safest and most enjoyable rafting experience for beginners with calm waters and fun rapids.
brahmpuri-rafting.overview: Brahmpuri rafting is the most beginner-friendly stretch on the River Ganga. This route combines calm river flow with small, playful rapids, making it perfect for families, children, and first-time rafters. The stretch allows participants to learn paddling techniques, understand river behavior, and enjoy body surfing under expert supervision.

rapids.name: Sweet Sixteen
rapids.why_this_name: The rapid is named 'Sweet Sixteen' because of its smooth, gentle waves that feel exciting yet harmless — much like a sweet introduction to rafting, especially for beginners.
rapids.description: Sweet Sixteen is the first rapid most rafters encounter on this stretch. It consists of small rolling waves that gently rock the raft without strong turbulence. This rapid helps first-time rafters get comfortable with paddling, balance, and water movement.
rapids.safety_notes: Extremely safe rapid with minimal risk. Perfect for children and nervous participants.

rapids.name: Body Surfing
rapids.why_this_name: This rapid is famous for guided body surfing sessions where participants float through calm currents using life jackets, hence the name 'Body Surfing'.
rapids.description: Body Surfing rapid has a slightly faster current that allows rafters to safely jump into the water under guide supervision. Participants float downstream while holding safety lines, experiencing the river directly.
rapids.safety_notes: Life jackets are mandatory. Guides closely monitor all participants during body surfing.

faqs.q: Is Brahmpuri rafting safe for beginners?
faqs.a: Yes, this stretch is the safest rafting option in Rishikesh and is ideal for beginners and families.

faqs.q: Do I need to know swimming?
faqs.a: No, swimming is not required. Life jackets are compulsory and ensure complete safety.
Yes, children above 12 years can safely participate under guide supervision.

shivpuri-rafting.name: Shivpuri Thrill Rafting
shivpuri-rafting.tagline: The most popular rafting stretch in Rishikesh packed with thrilling rapids and long river flow.
shivpuri-rafting.overview: Shivpuri rafting is the most popular and balanced rafting stretch on the River Ganga. It offers a perfect mix of excitement and safety with continuous rapids, stronger currents, and iconic wave trains. This stretch is ideal for beginners who want thrill and for regular rafters looking for fun without extreme difficulty.

rapids.name: Jai Ganga Maiya
rapids.why_this_name: Named by local river guides as a respectful greeting to the holy River Ganga, marking the beginning of the thrilling rafting stretch.
rapids.description: This rapid welcomes rafters with wide, rolling waves that create excitement without being aggressive. It helps rafters build rhythm and confidence early in the run.
rapids.safety_notes: Safe rapid with controlled water flow. Ideal to prepare for upcoming rapids.

rapids.name: Roller Coaster
rapids.why_this_name: Named after the roller-coaster-like motion of the raft going up and down through powerful standing waves.
rapids.description: Roller Coaster is one of the most exciting rapids in Shivpuri rafting. The raft moves through a series of high, continuous waves that lift and drop the raft repeatedly, delivering pure adrenaline.
rapids.safety_notes: Guides provide clear commands. Falling out is rare but swimmers are quickly rescued.

rapids.name: Golf Course
rapids.why_this_name: The rapid passes alongside a golf course, and the scattered rocks resemble a golf field layout.
rapids.description: Golf Course rapid requires coordinated paddling as the raft navigates through multiple channels. It tests teamwork and guide skill.
rapids.safety_notes: Requires listening carefully to guide instructions.

rapids.name: Club House
rapids.why_this_name: Named because it marks the end of the main rapid section, similar to reaching a clubhouse after a game.
rapids.description: Club House is a fun rapid that signals the end of the intense section. It has playful waves and allows rafters to relax and celebrate.
rapids.safety_notes: Very safe rapid with low risk.

marine-drive-rafting.name: Marine Drive Extreme Rafting
marine-drive-rafting.tagline: High-adrenaline rafting with powerful rapids and long continuous river stretches.
marine-drive-rafting.overview: Marine Drive rafting is a long and challenging stretch offering some of the most powerful and technical rapids on the River Ganga. With extended river time, strong currents, and famous Grade III–IV rapids, this stretch is designed for thrill seekers who want sustained excitement rather than short bursts.

rapids.name: Three Blind Mice
rapids.why_this_name: The rapid consists of three successive drops that must be navigated carefully, much like moving blindly through obstacles.
rapids.description: This rapid introduces rafters to fast drops and sudden turns. It requires precise paddling and quick guide commands.
rapids.safety_notes: Guides position the raft carefully to avoid rocks.

rapids.name: Crossfire
rapids.why_this_name: Named due to two strong currents colliding from opposite directions, creating turbulent water.
rapids.description: Crossfire tests teamwork as the raft faces powerful cross-currents that can spin it if not handled properly.
rapids.safety_notes: Paddling commands must be followed strictly.

rapids.name: The Wall
rapids.why_this_name: A massive standing wave forms a wall-like structure that the raft must punch through.
rapids.description: The Wall is the most famous rapid of Marine Drive rafting. The raft hits a huge wave head-on, often completely submerging the front before emerging dramatically.
rapids.safety_notes: Strong swimmers and experienced guides are mandatory for this rapid.

rapids.name: Scott’s Pride
rapids.why_this_name: Named after a legendary rafter who considered this rapid a personal favorite due to its clean wave flow.
rapids.description: A fast, flowing rapid that allows rafters to regain rhythm after intense sections while still enjoying powerful waves.

faqs.q: How difficult is The Wall rapid?
faqs.a: The Wall is a Grade IV rapid and offers a powerful hit with high adrenaline.

kaudiyala-rafting.name: Kaudiyala Challenge Rafting
kaudiyala-rafting.tagline: The ultimate rafting challenge with continuous Grade IV+ rapids on the mighty Ganga.
kaudiyala-rafting.overview: Kaudiyala rafting is the longest and most demanding stretch in Rishikesh, featuring continuous high-grade rapids, strong currents, and technical river features. This stretch is strictly recommended for experienced rafters who are comfortable with turbulent water, aggressive waves, and extended paddling under expert supervision.

rapids.name: Daniel’s Dip
rapids.why_this_name: Named after a rafter who was famously flipped and submerged deep during early explorations of this stretch.
rapids.description: Daniel’s Dip begins with a steep drop followed by powerful waves that can completely engulf the raft.
rapids.safety_notes: Guides align the raft carefully to avoid lateral flips.

rapids.name: The Wall (Kaudiyala Section)
rapids.why_this_name: A towering standing wave creates a wall-like structure that must be punched directly.
rapids.description: Bigger and more aggressive than the Marine Drive Wall, this rapid hits with extreme force and demands perfect timing.
what_to_expect: High chance of full raft submersion
rapids.safety_notes: Only expert guides run this rapid under controlled conditions.

rapids.name: Five Blind Mice
rapids.why_this_name: An extension of Three Blind Mice, featuring five unpredictable drops instead of three.
rapids.description: This rapid combines continuous drops with cross-currents, testing endurance and coordination.
rapids.safety_notes: Team coordination is critical throughout this rapid.

rapids.name: Jail House
rapids.why_this_name: The rapid funnels through a narrow rock corridor resembling prison bars.
rapids.description: Jail House traps water into a confined space, creating violent turbulence and fast exits.
rapids.safety_notes: Strict adherence to guide commands is mandatory.
